DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study assess effectiveness alpha-D Glucosamine Sulfate/Standardized Extract Ginkgo Biloba Leaf versus comparator product osteoarthritis pain assess group change WOMAC™ Osteoarthritis Index Pain Subscale use Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) score subject osteoarthritis knee .
DOC.brief_title: A Double Blind , Placebo Controlled Parallel Study Efficacy Glucosamine Sulfate Potassium Chloride/Standardized Ginkgo Biloba Leaf Extract Adults With Osteoarthritis Knee .
DOC.criteria: Male female 4570 year age Body mass index ( BMI ) 18.039.9 kg/m2 If female , subject child bear potential OR female subject childbearing potential must agree use medically approve method birth control negative urine pregnancy test result . Primary secondary , unilateral bilateral osteoarthritis knee ( American College Rheumatology Clinical Criteria Classification ) characterize knee pain least 3 follow : Age > 50 year Stiffness < 30 minute Crepitus Bony Tenderness Bony enlargement No palpable warmth Self report difficulty perform least one follow activity knee pain : lifting carry grocery walk onequarter mile get chair go stairs mobility selfcare activity Able walk unassisted ( may use walk stick , crutch , knee brace ) Availability duration study period ( 2 week runin +12 week ) Subject agree use overthecounter medication natural health product intend treat OA pain runin period throughout study ( except rescue medication provide ) . Subject use therapy OA , exercise , heat/cold therapy , joint protection physiotherapy/occupational therapy agree continue therapy normal avoid change frequency intensity record therapy study diary Subject agree start new therapy OA course study Agrees maintain current exercise dietary habit duration study Has give voluntary , write , inform consent participate study Women pregnant , breastfeeding , plan become pregnant course trial Physical examination finding show severe articular inflammation Subject diagnosis rheumatoid arthritis , fibromyalgia , spinal disorder musculoskeletal disease Subject recommend knee surgery WOMAC Pain Scale Score < 4 total pain ( average question # 1 question # 5 ) screen baseline Subject kidney liver disease , blood disorder , active cancer and/or HIV infection Subjects significant medical history current metabolic disorder , thyroid disease , immune disorder and/or cardiovascular disease review Qualified Investigator ( QI ) . Subjects deem QI possible risk permit study . Subjects Type I II diabetes Subjects history seizure currently medication control seizures Subjects hypertension review Qualified Investigator ( QI ) . If subject consider risk permit study Subjects history reoccurring palpitation dizziness Use illicit drug history drug alcohol abuse past 2 year ( currently 2 standard alcoholic drink per day ) Planned surgery course trial Use intraarticular , oral parenteral corticosteroid , injectable prescription medication ( e.g. , Synvisc ) within 2 month prior randomization trial Subjects take prescription medication affect blood coagulation ( e.g . blood thinner , clot factor replacement , acetylsalicylic acid ) Subjects regularly take overthecounter medication ( e.g . acetylsalicylic acid , ibuprofen ) natural health product ( i.e . fish oil , vitamin E ) affect blood coagulation within 2 week randomization Requires use prescription drug control pain ( provide rescue medication ) Use oral topical prescription counter medication natural health product pain relief runin period trial ( provide rescue medication , rescue medication use within 72 hour prior baseline subsequent visit ) Use vitamin mineral natural health products/dietary supplement indicate arthritis glucosamine chondroitin sulfate within 2 week prior runin period trial Clinically significant abnormal laboratory result screen ( i.e . ≥ 2 time ULN ) Allergy sensitivity test product ingredient , include shellfish Allergy sensitivity acetaminophen , rescue medication Individuals cognitively impair and/or unable give inform consent Any condition Investigator 's opinion may adversely affect subject 's ability complete study measure may pose significant risk subject
